resolution.description: The problem described is an issue which will never be fixed.
resolution.name: Won't Fix

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

thisisnic commented on pull request #12531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12531#issuecomment-1055634145


   I'm afraid I'm not sure I'm in favour of merging this as it doesn't solve the original problem (activating Bootstrap 5 in order to use the search functionality) and whilst it may provide a partial solution to that, the substantial bit of the work (updating the custom JS) still remains, and there change to the look of the menu is for the worse, in my opinion, sorry.  I will nudge other committers to comment on this though, as they may feel differently.


-- 
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

To unsubscribe, e-mail: github-unsubscribe@arrow.apache.org

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

eitsupi commented on pull request #12531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12531#issuecomment-1055650934


   Note that if you remove extra.js and activate Bootstrap 5, you will be able to use the search function immediately.
   
   As a user of the arrow package, I have to say that for me, the search function is more necessary than the version switcher.
   The current R documentation is not searchable and I often have to search the source code on GitHub to get to the information.
   So I'm really hoping to be upgraded to Bootstrap 5 even if it make disable the version switcher.
   
   I think it's really great that you implemented the version switcher, and of course I will follow the decision of the members of this project.
   Unfortunately, I don't have the capability to modify extra.js. Please feel free to close this PR.


--

jonkeane commented on pull request #12531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12531#issuecomment-1055761755


   Hello, first I want to say thanks so much for all the work here + other PRs I've seen.
   
   As you both have mentioned: we're a bit stuck and have to choose between supporting search + the version picker we have without putting some time into the JS that does the version picking to be compatible with bootstrap 5. I agree that search is super important, but also that we don't want to lose our version picker since we do that for other languages that Arrow supports.
   
   Would it be possible to push to this branch | PR the changes that get us to using bootstrap 5 (even though it results in a broken site)? Mention the javascript issue, and then we can either leave this open or close it until we have the time to do the necessary javascript work. We'll have a record of what we need to do when we have that javascript skills + headspace to do it, but we don't break anything now. I'm also happy to make sure that you @eitsupi  are listed as a co-author of that PR|commit if + when it merges 


--

eitsupi commented on pull request #12531:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/12531#issuecomment-1056677377


   Thank you for checking.And, thank you again for your continued development of this project.
   
   As I mentioned in ARROW-15734, I created this PullRequest in preparation for the upgrade to Bootstrap 5 and intended it to be mergeable at this time.
   I apologize for mixing up changes that are essentially related to the upgrade to Bootstrap 5 with other changes.
   
   I would like to change this PR to only restore the GitHub icon and the title of the articles to the correct format, without changing the multi-level list of articles as pointed out.
   (It is hard to tell because there is no link from the top page, but some title of the articles are not recognized by pkgdown and the article list is broken. https://arrow.apache.org/docs/6.0/r/articles/)
   ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50911393/156334324-755331ae-d842-4c0d-9376-a273703281e5.png)
   
   Then, in addition to this PR, I will submit a separate PR that includes all of the current content of this PR and also activates Bootstrap5.


--

   As I mentioned in ARROW-15734, I created this PullRequest in preparation for the upgrade to Bootstrap 5 and intended it to be mergeable at this time.
   I apologize for mixing up changes that are essentially related to the upgrade to Bootstrap 5 with other changes.
   
   I would like to change this PR to only restore the GitHub icon and the title of the articles to the correct format, without changing the multi-level list of articles as pointed out.

+      - python
+      - flight
+  - title: Developers
+    navbar: Developers
+    contents:
+      - developing
+      - developers/setup
+      - developers/workflow
+      - developers/debugging
+      - developers/install_details
+      - developers/docker
+      - developers/bindings

Review comment:
       My explanation above was not adequate.
   Correctly, this added setting is for both the index of the article and the nav bar; it is currently overriding the setting for the nav bar, and the overridden setting takes precedence.

   > * With Bootstrap 5, the "index.html" link on projects on the nav bar is always selected when we open the index of the R document, and it doesn't look good, so change it to an absolute path like the other links.

fields.description:
Part of ARROW-15734

Need to change the configuration of the pkgdown site which is not compatible with bootstrap5.
